data.title: Mount Vernon Leadership Academy
data.text:
For the first day of school on Tuesday, September 3, high school students must report by 7:45 a.m., and students in grades K-8 must arrive at school by 8:30 a.m., or as instructed by your school building’s schedule. The first day of school is a half day, with high schools dismissing at 11:30 a.m. and elementary schools dismissing at 12 p.m. The first full day of school will be Wednesday, September 4.

If your child is in pre-kindergarten, please follow your orientation appointment. Pre-K classes will begin Thursday, September 5 and Friday, September 6, with half days from 8:30 to 11:30 a.m. The first full day of pre-K classes will be on Monday, September 9, from 8:30 a.m. to 2:50 p.m.

The Mount Vernon City School District is offering subsidized Metro Cards for $145 per semester, half of the full price of $290, for all grade 7-12 students. The Metro Card is only valid on Bee-Line buses, not MTA. Cards are valid for five months, September through January and February through June. Cards are valid Monday through Friday from 5:30 a.m. to 8:30 p.m. with up to four trips per day.

Contact Daffodil Graham at dgraham@mtvernoncsd.org, 914-358-2888, or in room 231 of Mount Vernon High School from 8 a.m. to 12 p.m. Monday through Friday. Submit cash or a money order payable to MVCSD to purchase the passes.

Incoming ninth graders at Mount Vernon High School are required to swap out their laptops for NEW ones and obtain their NEW school ID. Students will be able to receive their laptops and school IDs on Thursday, August 15, 2024. from 1 to 4 p.m. Don't miss the only time to swap laptops before the last week of September!

The Mount Vernon Public Library is hosting a free creative writing camp for children ages eight to 12. The camp will run from 10:30 a.m. to 2:30 p.m., Monday through Thursday, from August 12 to 27, 2024, in the Mount Vernon Public Library’s children room. Lessons will be taught by high school students in the Mount Vernon City School District, and the camp will focus on teaching basic literacy elements of creative writing through writing short stories. Click here to register!
